title: Ticket #3197: Lexer cut function causes runtime exception in Visual Studio 2010
description: The cut function in the Lexer class attempts to append a \0 to the end of a std::string. With Visual Studio 2010, even if there is enough "space" to do the append, if the position is outside of what the runtime thinks is the end of the string, a runtime exception will get thrown. The fix is just to check the size of the string before attempting to do the append.
